hotels.name: Four Seasons Astir Palace
hotels.desc: Luxury beachfront resort, Vouliagmeni peninsula, kids
hotels.longDesc: Sprawling luxury resort nestled on the Vouliagmeni peninsula with direct beach access and world-class kids' amenities. A serene escape from Athens with Acropolis views from the spa and multiple family-friendly pools.

hotels.name: Grande Bretagne
hotels.desc: Grand historic hotel, Syntagma, rooftop Acropolis views
hotels.longDesc: Athens' most iconic grand hotel since 1874, perched above Syntagma Square with commanding Acropolis views from the rooftop pool and restaurant. Timeless elegance and impeccable service for discerning families.

hotels.name: Hotel Amanzoe
hotels.desc: Aman ultra-luxury, hilltop pavilions, Porto Heli
hotels.longDesc: Ultra-luxury hilltop escape near Porto Heli with private pavilions overlooking the Peloponnese coast and a world-class spa. An intimate, adults-leaning property perfect for romantic getaways with design-conscious travelers.

hotels.name: Andronis Arcadia
hotels.longDesc: Quintessential Santorini charm with private pools, caldera views, and genuine family hospitality in picture-perfect Oia. The sunset from the terrace rivals any restaurant in town.

hotels.name: Katikies Hotel
hotels.longDesc: Iconic cave-style suites carved into the caldera cliffside with dramatic white interiors and infinity pools opening to the Aegean. Pure Santorini romance and architectural drama.

hotels.name: Canaves Oia Epitome
hotels.longDesc: Luxury resort with the celebrated Elements restaurant on-site, organic spa, and caldera-facing pools in serene Oia. An eco-conscious choice without compromising sophistication.

hotels.name: Santo Maris Oia
hotels.longDesc: Spacious, family-friendly Oia alternative with generous suites and a quieter vibe away from the sunset crowds. Perfect for families who want Santorini beauty without the tourist crush.

hotels.name: Vedema Resort
hotels.longDesc: Enchanting 400-year-old Venetian winery transformed into a luxury resort in the charming wine village of Megalochori. Stay amid Santorini's wine country and vineyard terraces.

hotels.name: Santa Marina Resort
hotels.longDesc: Private beach resort in calm Ornos Bay with excellent kids' amenities and direct sand accessâ€”ideal for families seeking Mykonos sophistication without the party scene.

hotels.name: Myconian Villa Collection
hotels.desc: Multi-bedroom villas, Elia Beach, calm location
hotels.longDesc: Spacious multi-bedroom villas perfect for large families or groups, set on peaceful Elia Beach away from Mykonos Town hustle. Ideal for self-catering flexibility.

hotels.name: Bill & Coo Suites
hotels.longDesc: Minimalist architectural gem on a cliffside overlooking Mykonos with an on-site Michelin-worthy gastronomy project and 280+ wine selections. Design lovers' paradise.

hotels.name: Domes Zeen Chania
hotels.longDesc: Contemporary design resort in Chania with excellent kids' facilities, spa, and easy access to western Crete's beaches and old town. Modern comfort in a historic setting.

hotels.name: Royal Senses Resort
hotels.longDesc: Family mega-resort in Crete with water park, kids' clubs, and a funicular down to the beachâ€”entertainment and relaxation all-in-one. Perfect for families who want activities built-in.

hotels.name: Ammos Hotel
hotels.desc: Boutique, supervised toddler playroom, sandy beach
hotels.longDesc: Charming Chania boutique with a supervised toddler playroom and direct sandy beach access, designed with young children in mind. Intimate and genuinely child-friendly.

hotels.name: Daios Cove
hotels.desc: Private beach, villas, infinity pool, Agios Nikolaos
hotels.longDesc: Luxurious cliff-top villas with infinity pools overlooking Agios Nikolaos bay in eastern Crete. Pure Mediterranean elegance and privacy.

hotels.name: Blue Palace
hotels.longDesc: Stunning beachfront luxury resort in Elounda with dramatic views of Spinalonga Island fortress across the bay. A serene, upscale Crete coastal escape.

hotels.name: Sani Resort
hotels.desc: 5 hotels, Bear Grylls kids activities, eco-reserve
hotels.longDesc: Sprawling 5-hotel complex on a private beachfront with Bear Grylls kids' activities, eco-reserve, and year-round entertainment on the Halkidiki peninsula. Ultimate all-in-one family destination.

hotels.name: Ikos Odisia
hotels.longDesc: All-inclusive ultra-luxury on a private Corfu beach with 10 heated pools and world-class dining options. Mediterranean indulgence for families.

hotels.name: Porto Zante Villas
hotels.longDesc: Nine luxury villas with private beach on Zakynthos, ideal for families seeking privacy and turtle-spotting access. Exclusively designed for multi-family groups.

hotels.name: Mandarin Oriental Costa Navarino
hotels.longDesc: Mega-luxury resort in Messinia with championship golf course, pristine beaches, and refined European sensibility. Pinnacle of Greek resort sophistication.

restaurants.name: Spondi
restaurants.desc: Two Michelin stars, modern Greek, neoclassical villa
restaurants.longDesc: Two Michelin stars in a refined neoclassical villa showcasing innovative modern Greek cuisine. An unforgettable gastronomic experience for special-occasion dinners.

restaurants.name: Delta
restaurants.desc: Two Michelin stars + Green Star, sustainable
restaurants.longDesc: Two Michelin stars plus Green Star recognition for sustainable sourcing in a forward-thinking Greek kitchen. Ethical fine dining done beautifully.

restaurants.name: Hytra
restaurants.desc: Michelin star, panoramic city views, Onassis Centre
restaurants.longDesc: Michelin-starred panoramic dining at the Onassis Centre with the Acropolis illuminated below your table. Theater meets gastronomy.

restaurants.name: Varoulko Seaside
restaurants.desc: Michelin star, Chef Lazarou, Piraeus harbor
restaurants.longDesc: Chef Lazarou's Michelin-starred seafood temple in Piraeus harbor with impeccable fresh catches and maritime views. Pure, honest Mediterranean cooking.

restaurants.name: Nolan
restaurants.longDesc: Michelin star fusion of Asian and Greek traditions in an intimate Athens setting. Unexpected flavor pairings executed with precision.

restaurants.name: Botrini
restaurants.desc: Michelin star, Italian-Greek, Chef Ettore Botrini
restaurants.longDesc: Michelin-starred Italian-Greek collaboration helmed by Chef Ettore Botrini, blending two Mediterranean heritages seamlessly. Italian technique meets Greek ingredients.

restaurants.name: Ta Karamanlidika
restaurants.longDesc: Historic deli-taverna specializing in cured meats and Byzantine-Anatolian mezeâ€”a flavor journey through Greece's complex cultural past. A local institution.

restaurants.name: Vezene
restaurants.longDesc: Cutting-edge Greek bistro pushing boundaries since 2011, balancing tradition with contemporary technique. Where ancient Greek flavors meet modern creativity.

restaurants.name: Kostas Souvlaki
restaurants.desc: Legendary hole-in-the-wall, best souvlaki in Athens
restaurants.longDesc: Legendary hole-in-the-wall serving the best souvlaki in Athens from a window counter since the 1950s. Simple, perfect, iconic.

restaurants.name: Selene
restaurants.desc: Pioneer of Santorinian cuisine, Pyrgos, since 1985
restaurants.longDesc: Pioneering Santorinian cuisine since 1985 in the village of Pyrgos using hyper-local ingredients and traditional recipes. The island's culinary soul.

restaurants.name: Elements at Canaves
restaurants.longDesc: Award-winning contemporary Greek dining with signature dry-aged scallops and caldera views from a cliffside terrace. Scenic splendor meets refined cooking.

restaurants.name: Koukoumavlos
restaurants.desc: Creative fine dining, Fira, volcano views
restaurants.longDesc: Creative fine dining overlooking the volcanic caldera from Fira with a wine list celebrating Greek producers. Every course paired with island scenery.

restaurants.name: To Psaraki
restaurants.desc: Vlichada fishing port, exceptional seafood, honest prices
restaurants.longDesc: Tiny waterfront taverna at the Vlichada fishing port serving whatever the boats brought in that morning at honest prices. Authenticity distilled.

restaurants.name: Ammoudi Fish Tavern
restaurants.desc: Tiny harbor below Oia, fresh-caught, sunset
restaurants.longDesc: Intimate harbor-side taverna perched in the tiny cove below Oia, serving fresh-caught seafood with sunset views that justify the walk. Quintessential Santorini romance.

restaurants.name: Matsuhisa Mykonos
restaurants.longDesc: Nobu's Mykonos outpost bringing Japanese-Peruvian precision to the Aegean island. High-end hospitality theater.

restaurants.name: Kiki
restaurants.desc: No sign, no electricity, legendary grilled pork chops
restaurants.longDesc: No sign, no electricity, just legendary grilled pork chops and Greek hospitality in a tiny Mykonos village taverna. Soul food for travelers.

restaurants.name: M-eating
restaurants.longDesc: Best fine dining on Mykonos island with technical execution and creative presentations in an intimate setting. Local chef, world-class standards.

restaurants.name: NiKolas Taverna
restaurants.longDesc: Traditional family-run taverna right at Agia Anna beach where fishermen still dock their boats nearby. Immediate freshness and generational authenticity.

restaurants.name: Peskesi
restaurants.longDesc: Farm-to-table restaurant in Heraklion serving 16th-19th century Cretan recipes using modern technique and foraged ingredients. Living culinary history.

restaurants.name: Thalassino Ageri
restaurants.longDesc: Waterfront seafood specialist in Chania's Old Harbor with white-tablecloth standards and fresh daily catches. Where Venetian architecture meets Mediterranean bounty.

restaurants.name: Tamam
restaurants.longDesc: Beautifully restored Turkish bathhouse in Chania now housing creative Cretan cuisine in atmospheric stone chambers. History and flavor combined.

restaurants.name: Avli
restaurants.longDesc: Award-winning restaurant in a 16th-century Venetian courtyard in Rethymnon, serving refined island cooking with artistic presentations. Cultural depth on every plate.

restaurants.name: Axiotissa
restaurants.longDesc: Farm-to-table gem in rural Naxos with a vine-covered pergola and direct access to organic island produce. Slow food done sincerely.

restaurants.name: Mario Restaurant
restaurants.longDesc: Gourmet seafood restaurant in Naoussa's picturesque harbor on Paros with direct views of fishing boats and sunset. Maritime excellence.

restaurants.name: Mavrikos
restaurants.longDesc: Family-run since 1933 in charming Lindos, Rhodes, serving traditional Greek cooking with recipes passed through generations. Living legacy.

restaurants.name: Etrusco
restaurants.longDesc: Mediterranean fine dining on a hilltop overlooking Corfu with panoramic Ionian Sea vistas and refined European technique. Scenic elevation.

restaurants.name: Line Athens
restaurants.longDesc: World's 50 Best Bar, showcasing creative cocktails in a historic Athens venue. Mixology excellence in an iconic setting.

restaurants.name: Baba Au Rum
restaurants.longDesc: World's 50 Best Bar specializing in rum cocktails with imaginative preparations in a vibrant Athens atmosphere. Spirits elevated to art.

restaurants.name: The Clumsies
restaurants.longDesc: World's 50 Best Bar in Athens delivering elegant cocktails and sophisticated hospitality in a charming townhouse. Elevated nightlife.

restaurants.name: Franco
restaurants.desc: Legendary caldera sunset, classical music, Fira
restaurants.longDesc: Legendary sunset cocktail bar in Fira with caldera views, classical music, and romantic ambiance as the sun descends. Pure Santorini magic.

restaurants.name: 180Â° Sunset Bar
restaurants.longDesc: Design-forward rooftop bar on Mykonos with sunset aperitifs and contemporary aesthetic overlooking the Aegean. Architectural minimalism meets golden hour.

restaurants.name: Scorpios
restaurants.desc: Bohemian sunset ritual, Paraga Beach, Mykonos
restaurants.longDesc: Bohemian sunset ritual at Paraga Beach on Mykonos with beach lounging, live music, and spiritual sunset energy. Hedonism with heart.

experiences.name: Acropolis & Parthenon
experiences.desc: Crown of Western civilization, book private family tour
experiences.longDesc: The crown jewel of Western civilizationâ€”the temple of Athena Parthenos crowning Athens' sacred rock. Book a private family tour for context and fewer crowds.

experiences.name: Acropolis Museum
experiences.desc: World-class, Parthenon Gallery, glass floor over excavations
experiences.longDesc: World-class museum directly beneath the Parthenon with a glass floor revealing ongoing excavations and the stunning Parthenon Gallery. Family-friendly architecture.

experiences.name: Palace of Knossos
experiences.desc: Minoan palace, King Minos
experiences.longDesc: Sprawling Minoan palace from 1700 BCE, the legendary home of King Minos and the mythological Labyrinth. Europe's oldest civilization makes Knossos an awe-inspiring journey.

experiences.name: Delos Island
experiences.desc: UNESCO, birthplace of Apollo, half-day from Mykonos
experiences.longDesc: UNESCO World Heritage birthplace of Apollo with haunting ruins and a half-day boat journey from Mykonos. Mystical archaeology.

experiences.name: Medieval Old Town Rhodes
experiences.desc: Largest inhabited medieval town in Europe, UNESCO
experiences.longDesc: Europe's largest inhabited medieval town with Knights Hospitaller architecture and winding cobbled streets frozen in time. A living, walkable history book.

experiences.name: Temple of Poseidon, Sounion
experiences.desc: Dramatic clifftop temple, spectacular sunset
experiences.longDesc: Dramatic clifftop temple perched 210 meters above the Aegean, built to honor the sea god and framing the most spectacular Greek sunset. Classical majesty.

experiences.name: Meteora Monasteries
experiences.desc: Surreal clifftop monasteries, UNESCO, 6 open to visitors
experiences.longDesc: Surreal UNESCO monasteries balanced atop impossibly high rock pillars, six remain active and open to visitors. Otherworldly spirituality.

experiences.name: Fira-Oia Hiking Trail
experiences.desc: 10km caldera-rim hike, breathtaking views, 3-4 hours
experiences.longDesc: 10-kilometer scenic caldera-rim hike connecting two Santorini villages with breathtaking cliff views of the volcanic crater. Three to four hours of pure Aegean beauty.

experiences.name: Sunset Catamaran Cruise
experiences.desc: Sail caldera, hot springs, snorkel, BBQ dinner onboard
experiences.longDesc: Sail into Santorini's caldera, swim in natural hot springs, explore volcanic beaches, and feast on a BBQ dinner as the sun melts into the sea. Ultimate Santorini experience.

experiences.name: Navagio Beach Viewpoint
experiences.desc: Most photographed beach in Greece, Zakynthos
experiences.longDesc: Most photographed beach in Greece features the iconic rusted shipwreck and turquoise cove on Zakynthos, accessible by boat or viewpoint hiking. Instagram-worthy authenticity.

experiences.name: Sarakiniko Beach
experiences.desc: Lunar white rock, turquoise pools, Milos
experiences.longDesc: Otherworldly lunar landscape of white weathered rock formations and crystalline turquoise pools on Milos island. Alien beauty.

experiences.name: Elafonissi Beach
experiences.desc: Pink sand, shallow lagoon, perfect for toddlers, Crete
experiences.longDesc: Unique pink-sand beach with protected shallow lagoon on Creteâ€”sensory and safe for small children. Natural wonder.

experiences.name: Balos Lagoon
experiences.desc: Turquoise lagoon, shallow warm water, Crete
experiences.longDesc: Turquoise paradise lagoon in northwest Crete with shallow, impossibly clear waters ideal for young swimmers and snorkelers. Picture-perfect.

experiences.name: Santo Wines Winery
experiences.desc: Famous Assyrtiko wines, caldera sunset views
experiences.longDesc: Wine shop with tasting bar on Santorini featuring local Assyrtiko and volcanic wine selections overlooking the caldera. Shop with a view.

experiences.name: Venetsanos Winery
experiences.desc: Restored 1947 winery, cliffside tasting terrace
experiences.longDesc: Restored 1947 winery carved into a clifftside with a tasting terrace overlooking the calderaâ€”wine, history, and vistas combined. Atmospheric excellence.

experiences.name: Akrotiri Archaeological Site
experiences.desc: Minoan city under volcanic ash, like Pompeii
experiences.longDesc: Preserved Minoan city frozen under volcanic ash like Pompeii, with intact streets, artifacts, and buildings from 1600 BCE. Time capsule excavation.

experiences.name: Spinalonga Island
experiences.desc: Venetian fortress, former leper colony, boat trip
experiences.longDesc: Venetian fortress turned haunting leper colony island, accessible by boat from Crete with layered history and island views. Poignant and powerful.

experiences.name: Hydra Island Day Trip
experiences.desc: Car-free island, donkey rides, 90 min from Piraeus
experiences.longDesc: Car-free island with donkey rides, harbor-side tavernas, and 90 minutes by ferry from Piraeusâ€”bohemian Mediterranean escape. Slow-paced perfection.

experiences.name: Symi Island Day Trip
experiences.desc: Colorful harbor, sponge shops, from Rhodes
experiences.longDesc: Colorful harbor village with photogenic houses climbing the hillside and traditional sponge shops, easily visited from Rhodes. Postcard-pretty.

experiences.name: CookInAthens Class
experiences.desc: 5-course cooking, market visit, wine pairings
experiences.longDesc: Five-course hands-on cooking class including market tour, wine pairings, and take-home recipes with English-speaking instructors. Culinary education and adventure.

experiences.name: Athens Food Tour
experiences.desc: Central Market, tastings at 8-10 stops, guided
experiences.longDesc: Guided tour of the Central Market with tastings at 8-10 food stops, family-friendly and conducted by passionate food historians. Gastronomic discovery.

experiences.name: Turtle Spotting
experiences.desc: Loggerhead sea turtles, Laganas Bay, Zakynthos
experiences.longDesc: Loggerhead sea turtles nesting and hatchling season (June-September) in Laganas Bay, Zakynthosâ€”evening boat tours for ethical wildlife encounters. Conservation and magic.

kidFriendly.name: Cretaquarium
kidFriendly.longDesc: Over 2,000 marine creatures from the Mediterranean and beyond in touch-pools and interactive exhibits, perfectly scaled for young explorers in Heraklion. Wet and wonderful.

kidFriendly.name: Attica Zoological Park
kidFriendly.desc: 290+ species, petting zoo, dolphin shows, Athens
kidFriendly.longDesc: 290+ animal species including petting zoo, dolphin shows, and exotic creatures on a sprawling grounds in Athens. All-day family entertainment.

kidFriendly.name: Allou! Fun Park
kidFriendly.desc: Theme park + Kidom for young kids, Athens
kidFriendly.longDesc: Amusement park with rides for all ages plus Kidom interactive play area specifically designed for young children in central Athens. Classic fun.

kidFriendly.name: Faliraki Water Park
kidFriendly.longDesc: Europe's largest water park on Rhodes with slides, lazy river, and family-friendly pools for every swimming ability. Splashy paradise.

kidFriendly.name: Water City
kidFriendly.longDesc: Crete water park with multiple slides, splash zones, and dedicated toddler areas for safe summer cooling-off. Smaller and more manageable than megaparks.

kidFriendly.name: Hellenic Children
kidFriendly.longDesc: Interactive museum for ages 2-12 in Plaka, Athens with hands-on exhibits exploring nature, science, and culture. Learning disguised as play.

kidFriendly.name: National Garden
kidFriendly.desc: Duck ponds, mini zoo, playground, shaded, Athens
kidFriendly.longDesc: Botanical oasis in downtown Athens with duck ponds, mini zoo, playground, and shaded walkwaysâ€”perfect for young kids needing green space. Urban escape.

kidFriendly.name: Flisvos Marina Playground
kidFriendly.longDesc: Modern waterfront playground with trampolines, slides, and seaside location in Athensâ€”a contemporary facilities favorite. Aegean backyard.

kidFriendly.name: Agios Georgios Beach
kidFriendly.desc: Best toddler beach, calm shallow water, Naxos
kidFriendly.longDesc: Best toddler beach on Naxos with calm, shallow water and soft sandâ€”a rarity in Greece. Safety and sunshine.

kidFriendly.name: Golden Beach
kidFriendly.desc: Long sandy, shallow, windsurfing for adults, Paros
kidFriendly.longDesc: Long sandy shallow beach on Paros suitable for young swimmers with windsurfing for adults on the side. Community-oriented.

kidFriendly.name: Elafonissi Beach
kidFriendly.desc: Pink sand, shallow lagoon, nature reserve, Crete
kidFriendly.longDesc: Unique pink-sand beach with protected shallow lagoon on Creteâ€”sensory and safe for small children. Natural wonder.

kidFriendly.name: St. Paul
kidFriendly.desc: Sheltered cove, clear water, Lindos, Rhodes
kidFriendly.longDesc: Sheltered cove beach near Lindos, Rhodes with calm clear waters protected from wavesâ€”a peaceful family swimming spot. Hidden gem.

kidFriendly.name: Perissa Beach
kidFriendly.longDesc: Black volcanic sand beach on Santorini with organized facilities, calm sections, and unique lunar landscape. Safe and otherworldly.

markets.name: Varvakios Central Market
markets.longDesc: Europe's most vibrant food market in downtown Athens with butchers, fishmongers, produce vendors, and aromatic spice stalls. Sensory overload in the best way.

markets.name: Monastiraki Flea Market
markets.longDesc: Antiques, vintage clothing, handcrafts, and souvenirs fill winding alleys with Sunday expansion for maximum browsing. Treasures hiding in chaos.

markets.name: Chania Central Market
markets.longDesc: Beautiful cross-shaped 1913 stone hall filled with Cretan productsâ€”cheeses, olive oil, herbs, and local crafts. Architectural charm meets gastronomy.

markets.name: Santo Wines Winery
markets.desc: Wine shop + tasting, Assyrtiko, caldera views
markets.longDesc: Wine shop with tasting bar on Santorini featuring local Assyrtiko and volcanic wine selections overlooking the caldera. Shop with a view.

markets.name: Naxos Old Market
markets.desc: Graviera cheese, kitron liqueur, honey, spoon sweets
markets.longDesc: Charming village market specializing in local Graviera cheese, kitron liqueur, island honey, and traditional spoon sweets. Sweet discovery.

markets.name: Heraklion Market Street
markets.longDesc: 1866 Street in Crete packed with herb vendors, cheese shops, leather goods, and local crafts from Cretan producers. Authentic commerce.
